name: ORDER_MED_4
description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the order record.

columns.name: E_PRES_EARLIEST_DAT
columns.description: This column stores the earliest date on which a prescription can be filled for a Schedule II controlled medication. The date must occur on or before the start date for the prescription. It can't be changed after the order is signed.

columns.name: ORDER_CONTEXT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the order context record associated with the order, which contains additional information about when the order is intended to be used.

columns.name: PREV_ORD_CONTEXT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the order context record associated with the order, which contains additional information about when the order is intended to be used.

columns.name: PARENT_ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the parent order record for Home Health (HH) orders.  An HH order is an order which represents documentation by a user whose scope of practice doesn't include editing prescription data.  Furthermore, the child order created will not be an actual prescription, but merely represents new instructions to the patient regarding how to take a medication.

columns.name: LINKED_OP_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the orders record. When Home Health and Hospice clinicians need to document a medication administration against an inpatient medication, a copy of the medication is created with an order mode of inpatient to document the administration. This column holds a link to the original outpatient medication.

columns.name: INTERFACE_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description: This column stores the ID of the interface status of the order.

columns.name: PRESC_ORD_SIG
columns.description: The originally prescribed medication instructions for an order. This will be null if the original  and current medication instructions are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.

columns.name: PRESC_ORD_MED_NAME
columns.description: The originally prescribed medication name for an order. This will be null if the original medication name and current medication name are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.

columns.name: PRESC_ORD_REFILLS
columns.description: The originally prescribed refills for an order. This will be null if the original refills and current refills are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.

columns.name: PRESC_ORD_QUANTITY
columns.description: The originally prescribed quantity for an order. This will be null if the original quantity and current quantity are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_EXT_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the order's authorizing provider is from an external provider database. 'Y' indicates that the provider does not have a provider record in this EHR system and is from an external provider database. 'N' or NULL indicates that the provider has a provider record in this EHR system.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_EXT_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the order's ordering provider is from an external provider database. 'Y' indicates that the provider does not have a provider record in this EHR system and is from an external provider database. 'N' or NULL indicates that the provider has a provider record in this EHR system.

columns.name: WAS_FMLY_CHECKED_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the medication order was compared to a formulary during signing. 'Y' indicates that the medication was compared to a payor-plan formulary, external formulary, or hospital formulary. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication was not compared to a formulary. This does not indicate that the medication is or is not on any formulary, only that a formulary was checked for the medication.

columns.name: SELECTED_CRCL_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description: The selected CrCl source category ID for the order record, indicating the source of the creatinine clearance (CrCl) value.

columns.name: CRCL_ORD_SPEC_VAL
columns.description: This column stores the creatinine clearance (CrCL) value in the order.

columns.name: SELECTED_SCR_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description: The selected sCr source category ID for the order record, indicating the source of the serum creatinine (sCr) value.

columns.name: SCR_ORD_SPEC_VAL
columns.description: The serum creatinine (sCr) value for the order record.

columns.name: TRANSIG_LANGUAGE_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the language record used for translating patient-facing information in this order record.

columns.name: TRANSIG_LANGUAGE_ID_LANGUAGE_NAME
columns.description: The language name. If the language is written and uses more than one script to represent it, the name will contain the script in parentheses after the language name.

columns.name: ORIG_DOSE_BEFORE_SWITCH
columns.description: The original dose of the medication before the dose was adjusted.

columns.name: ORIG_DOSE_UNIT_BEFORE_SWITCH_C_NAME
columns.description: The unit category ID for the order record.

columns.name: MAXDOSE_HARDSTOP_YN
columns.description: Indicate whether the max dose limit is a hard stop for this order. If "Yes", the max dose is a hard stop. Otherwise, the max dose is not a hard stop.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_DIST_C_NAME
columns.description: The district category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_CTY_C_NAME
columns.description: The county category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_CTRY_C_NAME
columns.description: The country category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_HOUSE
columns.description: The house number of the ordering provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_DIST_C_NAME
columns.description: The district category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_CNTY_C_NAME
columns.description: The county category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_CNTRY_C_NAME
columns.description: The country category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.

columns.name: MAX_BSA
columns.description: The maximum Body Surface Area (BSA) for an order, if the selected BSA is greater than this BSA then the selected BSA will be capped at this value.

columns.name: MAX_DAILY_DOSE
columns.description: Max daily dose value entered by the provider or defaulted as the calculated daily dose

columns.name: MAX_DLY_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The unit category ID for the orders record

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_HOUSE
columns.description: The house number of the authorizing provider for this order record.

columns.name: UNROUNDED_DOSE_MIN
columns.description: The unrounded dose of this order. If the dose has a range (e.g. 1-2 mg), this is the lower end of the range. If the dose does not have a range, then this will store the dose.

columns.name: UNROUNDED_DOSE_MAX
columns.description: The unrounded dose of this order. If the dose has a range (e.g. 1-2 mg), this is the upper end of the range. Otherwise, this is null.

columns.name: UNROUND_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The med & dose unit category ID for the unrounded dose of this order record.

columns.name: ION_SPEC_AC_AMT
columns.description: This column shows the amount of acetate that a provider entered in this order record. This column will be empty if a chloride:acetate ratio or maximize option was selected.

columns.name: ION_SPEC_AC_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The med & dose unit category ID for the acetate amount that a provider entered in this order record. This column will be empty if a chloride:acetate ratio or maximize option was selected.

columns.name: ION_MAXIMIZE_C_NAME
columns.description: The ion maximize selection category ID for the order record.

columns.name: ION_RATIO
columns.description: This column shows the chloride:acetate ratio option that was selected. This column is empty when a specified acetate amount was entered or when a maximize option was selected.

columns.name: ION_BASED_TPN_YN
columns.description: This column indicates how users specify electrolyte amounts for a total parenteral nutrition (TPN) order. 'Y' indicates that users enter amounts for specific ions to add in the TPN. 'N' indicates that users enter amounts for specific salts to add in the TPN.

columns.name: CALC_CL_AC_RATIO
columns.description: This column stores the calculated chloride:acetate ratio for an ion-based total parenteral nutrition (TPN).

columns.name: ION_PRI_CALC_AMT_C_NAME
columns.description: This column indicates whether the primary calculated amount is a weight-based or non-weight-based value.

columns.name: USE_AUC_DOSE_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the system should automatically update the dose for the order based on the area under the curve (AUC) calculations. 'Y' indicates that the system updates the dose based on AUC calculations. 'N' or NULL indicates that the system does not update the dose based on AUC calculations.

columns.name: EPRES_PHARMACY_ID
columns.description: This column stores the ID of the pharmacy that accepted the prescription.

columns.name: EPRES_PHARMACIST_ID
columns.description: This column stores the ID of the pharmacist or pharmacy technician who accepted the prescription.

columns.name: EPRES_PHARMACIST_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: RX_ACCEPT_DTTM
columns.description: Stores the instant at which the prescription was accepted.

columns.name: RPTSIG_EXISTS_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the patient has indicated that they are taking this med differently from how it was prescribed to them for this order. If yes, the patient reported that they are taking the med differently. If no or null, the patient did not report that they are taking the med differently.

columns.name: HOLD_PENDING_PA_YN
columns.description: This item indicates whether the order is waiting for a prior authorization request to be completed before being sent to its final destination.

columns.name: SEND_PA_REQ_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether a prior authorization request should be sent for a medication order when it is signed. 'Y' indicates that a prior authorization request should be sent. 'N' indicates that a prior authorization request should not be sent.

columns.name: PA_ORG_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the data exchange organization associated with the order record, which specifies the payer that a prior authorization request should be sent to when a medication order is signed.

columns.name: PA_ORG_ID_EXTERNAL_NAME
columns.description: Organization's external name used as the display name on forms and user interfaces.

columns.name: SCRIPT_SUP_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the provider under whose supervision a prescription was placed.

columns.name: ONE_STEP_MEDPROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record. This item points to a procedure order record for the procedure used to administer the medication. The item is populated when administering a medication that is documented as administered in an Ophthalmology or Orthopedic context.

columns.name: SPEC_DOSE_LMT_HR
columns.description: The number of hours the dosing limit represents.

columns.name: SPEC_MED_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The special medication type category ID for this order. This indicates whether the medication uses special dosing parameters, such as for patient-controlled analgesia orders.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the patient follow-up tracking record, which stores information about how a patient is transitioning from one medication to another.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description: The medication transition status category ID for the order record.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description: The medication transition status change reason category ID for the order record.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_CMT
columns.description: This item stores any additional comments about why the medication transition status was changed.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_USR_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the user who changed the transition status of the medication.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_USR_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_STAT_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time the medication transition status of the order was changed.

columns.name: DISCON_LOCAL_TIME
columns.description: This item stores the instant in the patient's local time zone that an order was discontinued.

columns.name: RX_REQUEST_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The prescription request type category ID for the order record

columns.name: DISC_WAIT_PA_YN
columns.description: This column indicates whether an order was discontinued while waiting for prior authorization.

columns.name: ERX_ORD_NAME
columns.description: The name of an order that was electronically prescribed.
